properties.name: Water System Improvements Project
properties.description: Approximately 7,090 linear feet of 6-inch diameter water main (new and replacement), 100 service connections with new curb stops, and associated fittings, valves, and appurtenances.

updates.text: Construction began. Road closures in effect with contractor signage.
Bids opened. AX&T Dirt Works selected as low bidder at $965,700.

properties.impact: Road closures during construction. Minimum 48-hour notice for any water service interruptions.

properties.name: Jefferson River Flood Mitigation Project
properties.description: Nature-based flood mitigation using a grass-lined conveyance channel approximately 8,000 linear feet (~1.5 miles) to intercept Jefferson River flood waters west of town. Channel dimensions: 100 feet wide, 5 feet deep, with 3:1 side slopes. Includes culvert crossing under MT Highway 2 and a recreation pond.

updates.text: Design 75% complete. Bid process expected Sept-Oct 2025. Construction to start late 2025 or Spring 2026.
City Council approved Draw #1 from FMA Grant ($110,103.68).
Team presented at National Conference in New Orleans.
Presented at Montana Floodplain Managers' Conference in Missoula.

properties.impact: SID #34 assessment: $195/year for 20 years ($3,900 total) per affected property.
benefits: Removes western Three Forks from 100-year AND 500-year floodplains
Mitigates $62-96 million in potential flood damages

properties.name: Flood Mitigation Recreation Pond
properties.description: Recreation pond near US Highway 2, part of the Jefferson River Flood Mitigation Project. Will enhance an existing pond for water storage, fire district use, and community recreation.
properties.impact: Located between Front Road and Sabena Road, approximately one mile west of downtown.

properties.name: Wastewater System Improvements
properties.description: Preliminary Engineering Report (PER) in progress for proposed improvements to the City's wastewater system. Project scope to be determined through PER findings.
funding_sources: To be determined through PER process

updates.text: Public hearing held to obtain comments on proposed wastewater improvements.
City Council hearing on rate increases to support infrastructure improvements.

properties.impact: Water and sewer rate increases proposed ($5/month each) to meet grant eligibility requirements.

properties.name: Lead Service Line Replacement Program
properties.description: Replacement of all lead, galvanized, and unknown service lines as required by the Lead and Copper Rule Improvements (LCRI) by 2037. Initial project to replace 150 service lines.
funding_sources: Federal Lead Service Line Replacement funding

updates.text: Planning phase. Seeking SRF funding prior to 2027 deadline.
Service line inventory in progress per LCRI requirements.

properties.impact: Estimated cost of $15,000 per service line based on recent bid tabs.

properties.name: Headwaters Trail Rehabilitation - East of Madison River
properties.description: Trail rehabilitation on the Headwaters Trail System east of the Madison River Bridge. Part of the 12-mile paved trail network running along the former Milwaukee Railroad bed.

updates.text: FWP recommended $87,000 Trail Stewardship Grant award. Public comment period opened.
Previous $54,000 TSP grant completed for earlier trail rehabilitation.

properties.impact: Trail sections may have temporary closures during rehabilitation work.
benefits: Maintains connectivity to Headwaters State Park and Droulliard Fishing Access
